meanings.definition: To feel mild astonishment or shock.
meanings.sent1: I was surprised by the sudden loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She looked surprised when she saw the birthday cake.
meanings.sent3: The cat was surprised to see a mouse in the house.
meanings.sent4: The news of the snow in summer surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick left the audience pleasantly surprised.

meanings.sent1: He was surprised by a familiar face in a foreign country.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was surprised by a beautiful waterfall on the trail.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was surprised by a nut falling from the tree.
meanings.sent4: The detective was surprised by a clue hidden in plain sight.
meanings.sent5: The student was pleasantly surprised by an unexpected bonus question on the test.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel astonishment or shock.
meanings.sent1: The loud fireworks surprised the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent2: The plot twist in the movie surprised the audience.
meanings.sent3: The prank surprised her, but she laughed it off.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected gift surprised her with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sudden rain surprised the picnic attendees.
